liposomal green tea extract.notes: Encapsulated EGCG and catechins; bypasses degradation and improves cellular delivery

oxidized green tea extract.notes: Degraded by heat, light, or pH; ineffective

grape seed extract (95% proanthocyanidin.notes: High OPC content; potent antioxidant and vascular support

grape seed phytosome.notes: Phospholipid-bound OPCs; enhanced solubility and intestinal uptake

liposomal grape seed extract.notes: Encapsulated OPCs and catechins; bypasses degradation and improves cellular delivery

whole grape extract.notes: Includes skin, pulp, and seed; broader polyphenol spectrum but lower OPC concentration

oxidized grape seed extract.notes: Degraded by heat, light, or pH; ineffective

pycnogenol.notes: Patented French maritime pine extract; standardized to 65–75% procyanidins; supports circulation, inflammation, and antioxidant defense

generic pine bark extract.notes: Variable source and potency; may lack standardization and consistent OPC content

pine bark phytosome.notes: Phospholipid-bound procyanidins; enhanced solubility and intestinal uptake

liposomal pine bark extract.notes: Encapsulated for enhanced delivery and cellular uptake

oxidized pine bark extract.notes: Degraded by heat or oxidation; ineffective

panax ginseng extract (4–7% ginsenosides.notes: Asian ginseng; adaptogenic effects on energy, stress, and cognition; standardized to ginsenosides Rg1, Rb1, and Re

fermented red ginseng.notes: Enhanced bioavailability via microbial fermentation; higher levels of Rg3, Rg5, Rk1, and compound K

black ginseng.notes: Nine-cycle steamed ginseng; enriched in low-MW ginsenosides; potent antioxidant and immune effects

american ginseng (panax quinquefolius).notes: Cooling adaptogen; higher Rb1 and Re; supports immunity and blood sugar regulation

siberian ginseng (eleuthero).notes: Not true ginseng; contains eleutherosides; supports endurance and stress resilience

liposomal ginseng.notes: Encapsulated for enhanced delivery and cellular uptake

oxidized ginseng.notes: Degraded by heat or oxidation; ineffective

echinacea purpurea extract (4% phenolics.notes: Most studied species; supports innate immunity via alkylamides and caffeic acid derivatives

echinacea angustifolia.notes: Traditional root extract; higher alkylamide content; immune and anti-inflammatory effects

echinacea phytosome.notes: Phospholipid-bound alkylamides; enhanced solubility and intestinal uptake

liposomal echinacea.notes: Encapsulated for enhanced delivery and cellular uptake

whole echinacea herb.notes: Non-standardized; variable alkylamide and phenolic content

oxidized echinacea.notes: Degraded by heat or oxidation; ineffective

turmeric extract (95% curcuminoids).notes: Standardized for curcumin; absorption enhanced with piperine or lipids

whole turmeric powder.notes: Low curcumin content; poorly absorbed without enhancers

liposomal curcumin.notes: Encapsulated for enhanced delivery; up to 50x absorption

curcumin with piperine.notes: Black pepper extract boosts curcumin bioavailability by 2000%

aged garlic extract.notes: Stable water-soluble compounds like SAC and SAMC

garlic powder.notes: Depends on processing; may lack active sulfur compounds

cranberry extract (25% proanthocyanidins.notes: Standardized PACs; supports urinary tract health

whole cranberry powder.notes: Contains fiber, sugars, and non-standardized PACs

cranberry juice concentrate.notes: High sugar content; PACs may be degraded

bilberry extract (25% anthocyanins).notes: Supports retinal health; rich in anthocyanosides

whole bilberry powder.notes: Lower anthocyanin content; includes fiber and sugars

bilberry juice concentrate.notes: Anthocyanins may degrade; sugar content varies

whole elderberry powder.notes: Contains fiber and sugars; lower anthocyanin content

elderberry syrup.notes: Traditional form; sugar content may affect absorption

plant-based enzyme complex.notes: Broad-spectrum enzymes from fungal or botanical sources

pancreatic enzymes (animal-derived).notes: Requires enteric coating; sensitive to stomach acid

individual enzymes (protease, lipase, am.notes: Targeted enzyme support; often used in blends and condition-specific therapies

enteric-coated enzymes.notes: Protected from stomach acid; ideal for pancreatic enzymes and systemic use

oxidized enzymes.notes: Degraded by heat, light, or improper storage; ineffective

nicotinamide riboside (NR).notes: Patented NAD+ precursor; good oral bioavailability

nicotinamide mononucleotide (NMN).notes: Direct NAD+ precursor; newer data supports oral uptake

niacinamide (nicotinamide).notes: Non-flushing B3 form; lower NAD+ conversion efficiency

niacin (nicotinic acid).notes: Flushing form of B3; converts to NAD+ but less tolerable

5-MTHF (L-methylfolate).notes: Active folate; bypasses MTHFR genetic issues

folic acid.notes: Synthetic form; requires conversion via DHFR; not suitable for MTHFR mutations

folinic acid (calcium folinate).notes: Bypasses initial conversion steps; helpful in methylation disorders

methylcobalamin.notes: Active form for neurological and methylation support

hydroxocobalamin.notes: Detox-supporting B12; used in injections and cyanide poisoning

cyanocobalamin.notes: Synthetic form; must be converted; lower biological activity
